CAN: The student may draw a simple picture of either an ice cube or water, but not both. They might show ice in a blocky shape or water as a simple wavy line.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to show the melting process as a change from ice to water or vice versa (the concept of change may not be clear).
The student will likely not include labels describing characteristics of the ice and water (may not understand characteristics).
The student will not show a sequence or steps that highlight heating or cooling (possibly doesn't understand cause and effect).
The student may not attempt a written explanation connecting their drawing to the concept of reversible changes (likely doesn't understand reversibility).
